byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Maher Sattar from Dhaka, Bangladesh.
byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and MAHER SATTAR

abstract: Authorities in Bangladesh begin urgent search for men suspected of coordinating activities for Islamic State in country; government formerly dismissed group's claims of responsibility for attacks in Bangladesh, attributing violence to home-grown extremists.
lead_paragraph: A list of suspects released after the Dhaka cafe siege includes men that the police have long sought as operatives for the Islamic State.

headline.main: Bangladesh, Blaming Local Groups for Attacks, Seeks Suspects Tied to ISIS
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh in Urgent Hunt to Root Out Recruiters for Islamic State

snippet: A list of suspects released after the Dhaka cafe siege includes men that the police have long sought as operatives for the Islamic State....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
